page.title: 05LANDSCAPE
page.content: {Burnopfield is situated on the south {side of the Derwent Valley.The lowest {point in the area is at Friarside to {the north of Burnopfield,lower down {the Derwent Valley,at a height of 245 {feet above sea level.As one goes south {from Burnopfield the land continues to {rise until it reaches the highest {point,745 feet above sea level at the {Hobson on the A 692.The land then {falls away again to a height of 515 {feet above sea level in the south east {of the area near Oxpasture Hill. { It is mainly an agricultural {area,with several areas of woodland {usually mixed woodland. { Farmland is mostly intensively {managed grassland with some crops. { }
